node.title: A Mermaid Finds Her Captain
node.description: Kathleen Reardon, who has “an affinity for all things mermaid,” knew Timothy Agra was a good catch when she learned he has a captain’s license.
node.content: ["Timothy Agra has a law degree, but it was his captain\u2019s license that made him the perfect match for Kathleen Reardon.", "\u201cEver since I was little, I\u2019ve had an affinity for all things mermaid. It doesn\u2019t hurt that I have long red hair and used to pretend I was Ariel,\u201d Ms. Reardon said. \u201cThe running joke of our courtship was, \u2018He\u2019s my captain, and I\u2019m his mermaid.\u2019\u201d", "Mr. Agra, 33, of Barrington, Ill., graduated from Loyola University in Chicago and has a law degree from the University of Southern California. He is the director of legal affairs and public policy for his family\u2019s business, Chicago\u2019s First Lady Cruises, which offers cruise tours. \u201cIt\u2019s a fourth generation company that provides architecture tours along the Chicago River,\u201d said Mr. Agra, who obtained a merchant mariner credential while working for the company.", "Ms. Reardon, 33, from Inverness, Ill., has a bachelor\u2019s degree in fashion merchandising and marketing from Bradley University. She works as a marketplace project manager for Postal, an offline marketing automation platform.", "The two now reside in Arlington Heights, Ill., but met through the dating app Bumble when both lived in Chicago. After connecting, Mr. Agra and Ms. Reardon discovered they grew up just a few miles apart and had crossed paths many times before, including when she went on a dinner cruise aboard one of his family\u2019s boats. Growing up, both also frequented the same bowling alley and Chinese restaurant.", "Their first date, on March 31, 2018, was drinks at the Game Room at the Chicago Athletic Association hotel. The night before, Ms. Reardon said, \u201cI sat in bed and wrote a list of attributes my \u2018dream guy\u2019 would have and tucked it away in my top drawer. I feel like I manifested this man into existence.\u201d", "They made plans to meet again the following Saturday. But the Wednesday before, he surprised her at her office with pink tulips and chocolate. \u201cI can\u2019t possibly wait until the weekend to see you again,\u201d Mr. Agra recalled saying when he delivered the gift.", "On Aug. 24, 2019, he proposed at Lurie Garden in Millennium Park. To ensure Ms. Reardon would \u201cgussy up,\u201d Mr. Agra said he fibbed and told her they were going to a \u201cwork-related\u201d event at the Art Institute of Chicago. She isn\u2019t a \u201cpropose to me after hiking and not wearing makeup kind of girl,\u201d he added.", "Later, the couple had dinner at the Chicago Athletic Association. \u201cThey had a special menu for us and glasses of Champagne \u2014 it was a magical night,\u201d Ms. Reardon said.", "[Click here to binge read this week\u2019s featured couples.]", "They were wed Oct. 23 at the University Club of Chicago in Cathedral Hall. \u201cIt\u2019s this grand room with high ceilings and stained-glass windows that overlooks Michigan Avenue,\u201d Ms. Reardon said. The bride\u2019s uncle and godfather, Patrick Reardon, ordained by the Universal Life Church, officiated. Mr. Agra was so excited to be married that he said \u201cI do\u201d before he was supposed to.", "Before the ceremony, Mr. Agra gave Ms. Reardon a model boat with \u201cLady Katie\u201d painted across the back. A nautical theme inspired much of their wedding: The bride entered the ceremony to an acoustic version of \u201cKiss the Girl\u201d from the \u201cLittle Mermaid,\u201d props for a photo booth included a captain\u2019s hat, groomsmen wore socks with anchors on them and the couple\u2019s first dance was to \u201cBeyond the Sea\u201d by Bobby Darin.", "At the reception, Ms. Reardon also sang a rendition of \u201cEverlasting Love,\u201d an instrumental version of which played as they exited the ceremony as a married couple.", "\u201cI thought she sounded great,\u201d Mr. Agra said. \u201cIt looked like the band members were impressed, too.\u201d", "About 174 guests were in attendance; the couple said all were urged to take a Covid test or get vaccinated ahead of the event. ", "\u201cIt was such a magical day,\u201d Mr. Agra said. \u201cIt went so swimmingly. We couldn\u2019t be happier.\u201d"]
